alert.note: Alert for Central Carbon County; Ferris, Seminoe, Shirley Mountains; North Snowy Range Foothills; Shirley Basin; Southwest Carbon County (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued December 31 at 4:03AM MST until January 02 at 11:00PM MST by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 11 PM THIS EVENING TO 11 PM MST MONDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected, along with areas of blowing snow. Total snow accumulations of 8 to 12 inches in the lower elevations, with 18 to 24 inches possible over mountain tops and high ridges. Winds gusting as high as 35 MPH. * WHERE...Much of Carbon County including Baggs, Rawlins, Muddy Gap, Shirley Basin, Medicine Bow, Elk Mountain, and Arlington. The highest amounts are expected over the Ferris, Seminoe, and Shirley Mountains as well as the foothills of the Sierra Madre Range south of Rawlins. * WHEN...11 PM MST this evening until 11 PM MST Monday. * IMPACTS...Extremely dangerous or impossible travel conditions due to icy, snow packed roads and significantly reduced visibilities in falling and blowing snow. Outdoor recreation will be hazardous and may be life threatening to those caught unprepared for severe winter conditions. Hikers and snowmobilers can become disoriented in near whiteout conditions, and could become lost or stranded.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
